title: 6 Quick Steps to Change the Size of an Image on Paint.NET

steps.title: Open the image you want to resize.
steps.content: Open the image you want to resize. You can click File , and then Open to select the image. [1] X Research source If you don't already have Paint.NET, you can install it from the official website .

steps.title: Click Image.
steps.content: Click Image . This is in the top toolbar between View and Layers .

steps.title: Click Resize.
steps.content: Click Resize . You can also use the shortcut CTRL + R . A new window will open.

steps.title: Input a new size.
steps.content: Input a new size. You can choose to resize the image by percentage or by absolute size. By percentage : Enter a new percentage. A number below 100 will shrink the image, and a number above 100 will expand the image. By absolute size : Set the width, height, and/or resolution for the Pixel size . Alternatively, set the width and height for the Print size . Make sure the box is checked for Maintain aspect ratio . When this is checked, you can change the value of the width and Paint.NET will automatically calculate the correct value for the height (or vice versa) so the image won't get distorted.

steps.title: Click OK.
steps.content: Click OK . This is at the bottom of the window. The new size will be reflected. If you don't like the new image size, click Edit > Undo or CTRL + Z and repeat the steps to enter a new size.

steps.title: Save the image.
steps.content: Save the image. Click File in the top-left corner and select Save or Save as . Enter a name, select a save location, and then click OK .
